definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: The headquarters favor located at Tangshan reach the ceramic city, the staff total nearly ten thousand people.
sentences.chinese: 总部位于唐山惠达陶瓷城，员工总数近万人。

sentences.english: In addition, rutin had the effect of raising the platelet count.
sentences.chinese: 另外，芦丁具有增加小鼠血小板总数的作用。

sentences.english: National-wide, females claim 38% of the total number of cadres.
sentences.chinese: 全国女干部的比例已占干部总数的38%以上。

sentences.english: PR8 Total number of substantiated complaints regarding breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data.
sentences.chinese: PR8违反客户隐私及遗失客户资料的申诉案总数。

sentences.english: Please let us know what the full quantity of your order is.
sentences.chinese: 请惠知本公司贵方订单的总数。

sentences.english: Over $10 million were bet on the Hong Kong Derby last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年香港马赛上的赌金总数达一千多万美元。

sentences.english: And they said unto Moses, Thy servants have taken the sum of the men of war which are under our charge, and there lacketh not one man of us.
sentences.chinese: 对他说，仆人权下的兵已经计算总数，并不短少一人。

sentences.english: China generates a total of 9 million tons of hazardous waste every year.
sentences.chinese: 中国每年产生有害废物的总数为九百万吨。

sentences.english: Paralytic rabies accounts for about 30% of the total number of human cases.
sentences.chinese: 早瘫性狂犬病约占人类死亡病例总数的30%。

sentences.english: The total bacteria numbers and population of each section daring the flood period are greater than in dry season.
sentences.chinese: 各断面的细菌总数和种属数，都是丰水期大于枯水期。

sentences.english: It's now 20 times the allowable amounts in the US and Europe.
sentences.chinese: 现在的总数是美国和欧洲许可数量的20倍。

sentences.english: WHO's estimated financial requirement is a total of US$ 12.3 million.
sentences.chinese: 世卫组织估计的资金需求总数为1230万美元。

sentences.english: Please work out the total amount of crude material in this project.
sentences.chinese: 请你计算出这个项目投料的总数。

sentences.english: Ridership was about 60% of what it was in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 地铁运载的乘客总数约为2009年的60%。

definition: to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
